review_title: Great Product, but I had a Manufacturing Defect
review_body: Great product, high performance machine, everything that I wanted when I purchased this. However, after working fine for a couple weeks (maybe a hiccup occasionally), the network adapter completely stopped working. No WiFi settings were even available in the settings. Upon looking in the Device Manager, the computer did not even recognize a WiFi adapter at all. It appears to be a manufacturing defect, so I will be shipping the computer back to be fixed. I will admit that this process hasn't been too bad, since this ordeal is occurred less than 90 days after the product was bought, I don't believe that I am paying any costs.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2021

product_name: Acer Swift X SFX14-41G-R1S6 Creator Laptop | 14" Full HD 100% sRGB | AMD Ryzen 7 5800U | NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti Laptop GPU | 16GB LPDDR4X | 512GB SSD | Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit KB | Amazon Alexa | Windows 10 Home
review_title: Lightest gaming laptop in the world
review_body: I love this laptop.  3.06 lbs and it can run triple-a games (with lower settings).  You don't even need to carry around the charger.  It supports USB-C power delivery up to 100w (i tested it with a watt meter) so you can have one charger for all of your devices saving even more weight.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2021

product_name: Acer Swift X SFX14-41G-R1S6 Creator Laptop | 14" Full HD 100% sRGB | AMD Ryzen 7 5800U | NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti Laptop GPU | 16GB LPDDR4X | 512GB SSD | Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit KB | Amazon Alexa | Windows 10 Home
review_body: I wanted a windows machine with discrete graphics and a quality display for photo and video work but I didn't want some 15.6-17" behemoth, nor could I really afford a Razer or some other $2000 ultra portable. After exhaustive research and comparisons over a couple of months I decided the swift x was exactly at the price/performance intersection for me. It's a little thicker and heavier than I prefer for travel but given the massive performance it has over my old Yoga laptop I consider it a reasonable trade. The 16:10 display is not my preferred aspect ratio for lightroom and photoshop but I use a calibrated 4k external monitor for serious work sessions. The built in display has great gamut and color space specs and sharp details for a 1080 panel. Battery life is excellent if you're not flogging it. The fan ran an obnoxious amount out of the box, even at idle but a quick Google showed it was a known issue and a quick settings change quieted things right down. I haven't done much video work on it yet but I have some upcoming projects that will put the GPU to the test. It rips through lightroom and photoshop tasks with ease. It nips at the heels of my friend's top of the line Razer at a fraction of the price, and that's an Intel machine. If we got into multicore video work I would probably edge him out.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2022

review_body: I bought this laptop for college as I wanted something portable to carry around but powerful enough to run some games. Not only has this laptop blown me away but, I will recommend it for anyone looking for something around this price range. The Acer Swift X is the best bang for your buck as these specs cannot be found in any other 14-inch laptop around this price range. It has amazing battery life which is perfect for going to class without needing a charger and can literally play any game I throw at it. If you want something small but powerful that will not break the bank this laptop is perfect for you. Overall, I am really happy with this laptop and would recommend it to anyone who is considering purchasing it.

review_title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED LAPTOP, ONE OF THE BEST OPTIONS FOR THE PRICE
review_body: This is a very great laptop and offers a lot of specs that you normally see in higher priced laptops. This laptop is great for the price point and is very fast and has a nice sleek/light weight design. The fan can get loud at times, but it is expected since the laptop only has one fan. The laptop is great for students who wish to run software like AutoCAD and Matlab. It can also handle light gaming. I have been able to run games such as metal gear solid 5 with no issues. Warzone runs fine but will begin to heat up the laptop more quickly. The laptop also comes with an extra SSD slot with makes upgrading a breeze, no need to do any cloning if you do not know how to. You only need to format the new SSD to run. Overall, I am very happy with the purchase and would recommend it to anyone look for a great laptop in the 1000-dollar range.

review_body: Worked fine for a day or two, and then it wouldn't connect to Wifi or even be able to search for Wifi. I spent an hour working with Acer technical support only to determine that it was a hardware problem and that I would need to send it in for repairs. This was a repeated problem with Acer, I had to send my previous one in because it would overheat even from just watching Youtube videos, and sadly doesn't seem like something they have or will improve upon. This laptop seemed like it was going to be great, but having a problem large enough to render it unusable and warrant sending it in for repairs right off the bat was a terrible sign. I refunded my purchase and haven't looked back. You can do much better, especially for the $1,000+ you'll be putting down on this machine.

product_name: Acer Swift X SFX14-41G-R1S6 Creator Laptop | 14" Full HD 100% sRGB | AMD Ryzen 7 5800U | NVIDIA RTX 3050Ti Laptop GPU | 16GB LPDDR4X | 512GB SSD | Wi-Fi 6 | Backlit KB | Amazon Alexa | Windows 10 Home
review_body: So I got this to replace an aging 6 year old laptop. I'm not going into all the specs and that the Ram is soldered on and the upgrade ability of this device as its in the description and its easy to search info about it.  So my experience with this slim laptop is pretty good. The pros of this PC, aka things I like. The screen looks good, it has 16gb of ram, 512mb HDD, dedicated video card to handle some video encoding or light gaming (when your kids grab it), the keyboard is back lit, HDMI out, 2 USB 3.0, USB C, rather good battery life if you balance the power options, and it's light but not light that it feels cheap. The cons,aka thing I don't care for. The power adapter for this Acer Swift is very small and delicate,  the Ram is soldered on so if the Ram gives you issues its not as easy as popping in a new stick, it comes with more bloat ware apps installed than my last OEM laptop and lack of any additional inputs, besides the 2 USB, 1 USB c HDMI, and a headset port. Overall I like the laptop, but soldering on the Ram sucks, and give me another USB at least 3 should be a minimum to call this a "creator" laptop. It come with a 30 day of Norton and most of the Acer boatyard can be uninstalled.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2021

product_name: Dell Inspiron 14 Plus 7420 Laptop - 14 inch, 2.2K 16:10, Intel Core i7-12700H, 16GB DDR5 RAM, 1TB SSD, Intel Iris Xe, 2 Yr Onsite + AntiVirus, Dell Migrate, Windows 11 Pro + Office 365 - Atlantic Blue
review_body: As the owner of a four high-powered gaming laptops at 15.6 inches, I got this lighter, more portable 14-inch non-gaming laptop, the Dell Inspiron Plus 7420, which targets students, business people, and educators such as my wife and me. At a very competitive price point, you are definitely getting substantial upgrades to justify the “Plus” moniker: A 2.2K screen with 300 nits, which provides excellent brightness and clarity; a 16:10 screen aspect ratio for more vertical screen real estate, very handy for power users. You’re also getting the 12th-generation Intel Core processor, 16GB of RAM, a TB of SSD, and Windows 11 Pro. You’re also getting an upgraded battery. I haven’t tested it yet, but I’m confident it will fare far better than my gaming laptops, which give me only 2 hours.

review_body: This laptop performs as I would expect and the CPU has enough power to make using it an enjoyable experience for most tasks. The memory is half-soldered, which seems typical of these smaller laptops. It is Micron DDR5 4800. The 1TB SSD is a WD SN740. The screen looks good and I don't notice any bad backlight bleed. The camera is a jump up from the usual but still gets a bit grainy in low light. I have had no problems with the keyboard or fingerprint reader. Overall I find this setup to work well for general computing tasks. Gaming only works well with older games but this isn't a "gaming" laptop so I won't hold that against it. I was getting in the 30 FPS range with Doom Eternal on high settings.

product_name: Dell Inspiron 14 Plus 7420 Laptop - 14 inch, 2.2K 16:10, Intel Core i7-12700H, 16GB DDR5 RAM, 1TB SSD, Intel Iris Xe, 2 Yr Onsite + AntiVirus, Dell Migrate, Windows 11 Pro + Office 365 - Atlantic Blue
review_title: Does Not Become a Tablet; Runs Slow
review_body: First the obvious. This does not fold into a tablet. Before I ordered this, I watched several video reviews on the internet for the Inspiron 14 7420. It was great that it became a tablet. Well, buyer beware, because I watched videos for the 7420 2-in-1 which is a different model. Why would Dell name two very different products with the same name and model number? Anyway, the description is exactly what I got. I should have done more homework. Anyway, that has nothing to do with 3 out of 5 stars. This is a "good" laptop. Small with a nice, compact power brick. The battery is good when new. I like the fingerprint reader built into the power button. The trackpad has worked really well over the last couple days (I know others had issues). The keyboard is adequate - better than most in this ultra-thin style but not as good as the old laptop keyboards when they had built-in CD drives. Why 3/5 stars? The speed is comparable to my old Windows 8 computer that I upgraded to Windows 10. And there is a feeling of bloatware - hesitation when a program is taxed to open a new feature, for example. What to say that this is an i7? THIS SHOULD RUN MUCH FASTER. NO joke - I set up a Celeron J4125 mini-PC yesterday that cost $200 and it runs faster than this thing. I also have a 1-year old, low-end Alienware gaming PC that cost less than this and it is lightspeed faster. I don't understand how this could get good reviews all over the Internet. For everything I see, it should cost around $600, the specs be damned. At this price, at least I would expect a 17" screen like my Alienware which cost less.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2022

product_name: Dell Inspiron 14 Plus 7420 Laptop - 14 inch, 2.2K 16:10, Intel Core i7-12700H, 16GB DDR5 RAM, 1TB SSD, Intel Iris Xe, 2 Yr Onsite + AntiVirus, Dell Migrate, Windows 11 Pro + Office 365 - Atlantic Blue
review_title: Beautiful color, DDR5, Gen 4 NVMe SSD, and a great screen!
review_body: This Inspiron is so high up (in terms of cost and features), that it doesn’t really leave a lot of room for their XPS laptops. Even though the XPS is still Dell’s true flagship laptop, this Inspiron 14 plus offers basically everything you could want in a modern ultrabook apart from dedicated graphics. I reviewed the standard 14 inch model and even though these are roughy the same size, this Plus model is quite a bit heavier due to the more robust cooling system required for the 45 watt Core i7(12700H). It has 2x fans and larger heat pipes.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2022

product_name: Dell Inspiron 14 Plus 7420 Laptop - 14 inch, 2.2K 16:10, Intel Core i7-12700H, 16GB DDR5 RAM, 1TB SSD, Intel Iris Xe, 2 Yr Onsite + AntiVirus, Dell Migrate, Windows 11 Pro + Office 365 - Atlantic Blue
review_body: This is my first laptop (outside of Chromebooks) that I have gotten in a long time.  I mostly stick to desktop PC use at home.  I have avoided laptop computers for a while due to how slow they used to be.  Times have changed, and HDD's have evolved from platter, to SSD, to NVME m.2 SSD's.  That increase in drive performance has really helped with these modern laptops, like this Inspiron 7420.  The m.2 in this Inspiron was benchmarking around 5gb/sec read and 4.5gb/s write speeds, which annihilates even the trusty old 2.5" SSD's of the 2010's era.

review_body: Had high hopes, but had to return it: Dell Support Assist would not run, even after consulting with Dell, removing and re-installing the app, so I could not update any of the Dell apps or firmware. Sound was terrible, because I could not update the RealTech audio drivers from Dell, Windows Hello Face ID and Fingerprint ID did not work as the device would not find the camera, Finger Print app would not update or recognize any finger. Restored to out-of-box state twice and started from scratch, no help. Great looking device with decent specs, think I got a lemon though!

review_title: Brand new Dell Inspiron NOT FUNCTIONAL
review_body: We received a brand new Dell Inspiron for my husband, and it straight up does not work and seems to be configured incorrectly?? First of all, working on a Word document results in the screen freezing every 5 min. Keep in mind that no other apps were open at this time. Second, when the computer was put to sleep for 10 min and reopened, the drivers started updating with no warning. This proceeded to go on for 20 min. And lastly the final straw…there is no sound on this computer. Settings were checked-correct device was chosen, nothing’s on mute, etc. Extremely disappointed. A brand new computer should not have these issues.

review_title: Good for getting some work done.
review_body: So the one I got does not have a touch screen so I am not sure why it asked to rate a touch screen. This laptop is great if you want to get get work done and play some minecraft for a little bit. If you open up the back you can add an SSD and if you want you can replace the NVME it comes with for a 2280 nvme. It does also have replaceable memory so if you want to upgrade to dual channel you can. Now if you don't run it at at full brightness and settings you can get a pretty decent battery life out of it. So for average school work and for having work papers this is a great laptop. With the benefit of being able to play some games.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2022

review_body: This review pertains to the seller.  Like others here have noted, the laptop I received does not match the description on Amazon.  I purchase this specifically for the 500GB hard drive.  The laptop that arrived had only a 118GB size hard drive, 79GB of which was already gobbled up by Windows and pre-installed software.  Additionally, the description says it had Windows 10 installed.  The laptop that arrived had Windows 11.  There may have been other differences as well, but I stopped there.  This is being returned.  Amazon needs to step in and do something about the fraudulent description of this product.

review_body: I unpacked my new computer and it didn't work. I called Dell customer support and the lady said, "I am hardware support, the problem you are having is software. So I am going to hand you over to software support, however, be advised that they charge based on the amount of time it takes to resolved your problems". I said, "It is a brand computer, one hour out of the box, most of that time I have spent with you and you are telling me that Dell will not provide support without charging me?" She said yes. So I told her I was returning the Dell to Amazon and buying a hewlett Packard. I got the HP about 2 hours ago and it is up and running like a champ.

product_name: Dell Inspiron 3583 15” Laptop Intel Celeron – 128GB SSD – 4GB DDR4 – 1.6GHz - Intel UHD Graphics 610 - Windows 10 Home - Inspiron 15 3000 Series - New
review_title: I've used this for school since the beginning of the year and here are my general opinions
review_body: Overall, the laptop has some pros and cons.  For the pros, the display is very nice, it's comfortable to use and easy to get used to, and can handle some light work and the occasional game of Minecraft.  However, there are some issues.  This laptop has become fairly slow over time and it's often frustrating waiting for it to boot up for long periods of time.  Additionally the battery life isn't very good; when I first got it the life would survive for about 5 hours of casual youtube, and now it barely survives 2 hours of being asleep in my bookbag.  I wouldn't recommend this if you're looking for something that's long term quality, but if you just need something for here and now and plan on upgrading soon this could be fore you.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021

product_name: Dell Inspiron 3583 15” Laptop Intel Celeron – 128GB SSD – 4GB DDR4 – 1.6GHz - Intel UHD Graphics 610 - Windows 10 Home - Inspiron 15 3000 Series - New
review_body: What this is: A super lightweight laptop with a descent set of ports and a workable screen at a fantastic price with the latest Windows version. What it's not: a high-end speedster gaming laptop. This is an extremely power efficient, slower processor ensemble that easy to upgrade. It's is tuned by default to super power saver. IMO, that makes it almost unusable in real life. Set the power mode to performance, and it becomes a great media consumption, email, social, writing machine with a good 6 hrs of battery. Oh, there is an open slot to put any 2.5" (7-9mm) laptop drive inside and you can double the RAM memory for about $25. I'm buying two more to use as Linux machines. I was hesitant about this at first but very happy in the end.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 3, 2022

product_name: Dell Inspiron 3583 15” Laptop Intel Celeron – 128GB SSD – 4GB DDR4 – 1.6GHz - Intel UHD Graphics 610 - Windows 10 Home - Inspiron 15 3000 Series - New
review_title: Small issues based on current chip shortage.
review_body: The Dell model 3583 is specified (Dell Specs p.12) with an 8th generation Intel core i3, i5, or i7 CPU. I suspect due to the 'chip shortage' Dell was forced to dive into the ol' parts bin and ship this particular 3583 with an older - and MUCH lower specs - Pentium Gold 5th generation CPU with limited cache. To try to compensate, Dell also shipped this unit with a M.2 SSD rather than the spec'd spinning HDD.  That was very good of them. But the mis-match seems to be creating some lag in 'getting things done', although not critical. I may (probably) be wrong about this, but then I'm not a computer whiz. It would be great if Dell eventually tracked this order and in future shipped us a comparable Core i3 CPU with a realistic cache. Hey, I can dream! In addition - 3583 comes spec'd with Win 10 Home (not S mode). S mode sucks and the time it takes to dump it is a pain. 2cts.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021

product_name: Dell Inspiron 3583 15” Laptop Intel Celeron – 128GB SSD – 4GB DDR4 – 1.6GHz - Intel UHD Graphics 610 - Windows 10 Home - Inspiron 15 3000 Series - New
review_body: We were looking to get a second laptop as the pandemic had pushed both my partner and I to be working from home. We weren't looking for anything fancy, but we needed more oomph than a Chromebook. This Dell fit the bill. It's not going to wow you, but it's got enough power to support web browsing, doc and presentation creation, and graphic design programs all at once. It moves along at a nice clip, as well. It's not incredibly heavy, but it's certainly not designed as a "lightweight" solution. My one real complaint is that the mouse touchpad is awkwardly positioned and configured, which can slow me down while I'm trying to switch between applications. All in all, I'd recommend it as a basic and affordable option, but don't expect it to turn heads.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2021

review_body: This button-down dark gray HP laptop will spend the majority of its time doing algorithm driven stock index futures trading. For that task, it really has the Right Stuff; wired gigabit ethernet port, world beater office task performance, a bright, crisp 1K display, and the ability to drive a 4K external monitor to its full potential. Sometimes I'll bring this machine with me and the fact that its appearance has about a zero "Star Wars coefficient" is totally a plus. I like the keyboard, its nice white backlighting, and overall style and build of this machine.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 25, 2022

product_name: HP Victus 15.6" Gaming Laptop PC, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 Ti, AMD Ryzen 7 5800H, Refined 1080p IPS Display, Compact Design, All-in-One Keyboard with Enlarged Touchpad, HD Webcam (15-fb0028nr, 2022)
review_title: Streaming, Video edit, Casting, Gaming all possible
review_body: Shifting from a gaming Asus ROG laptop to this has been surprisingly wonderful/all around positive experience.  Only upgrades I did were the installation of a 2TB nvme Samsung 970, and doubled the ram.  However I did these upgrades well after already performing the tasks below.  However the ram and storage has made editing 4k recordings with no delays.  I also was able to get those components on a very good sale which justified the impulse as it was a nice to have not a need to have upgrade.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2022

product_name: HP Victus 15.6" Gaming Laptop PC, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 Ti, AMD Ryzen 7 5800H, Refined 1080p IPS Display, Compact Design, All-in-One Keyboard with Enlarged Touchpad, HD Webcam (15-fb0028nr, 2022)
review_body: What caught my attention most was how HP toned down the looks so this doesn't look like a gaming laptop, you can easily use this in a work environment without anyone knowing unless they saw the large power adapter.  Screens on gaming laptops make a difference in terms of brightness & sharpness, even though HP lists the screen at 250 nits yet it seems brighter than a laptop of mine with a 300 nit screen. The keyboard is nice with a number pad, typing on it is very comfortable without any flex and the white backlight for the keys is perfect.  I’ve used a lot of mid-tier laptops with a GPU over the years, the fan noise on the Victus is very reasonable in comparison.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2022

product_name: HP Victus 15.6" Gaming Laptop PC, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 Ti, AMD Ryzen 7 5800H, Refined 1080p IPS Display, Compact Design, All-in-One Keyboard with Enlarged Touchpad, HD Webcam (15-fb0028nr, 2022)
review_title: Not awful for gaming, good battery
review_body: Battery life has been good for me, and overall performance thanks to the 5800H has been great.  Advertising it as a "gaming" laptop is a bit of a stretch to me though.  It can handle most games...at very low settings.  Some "eSports" titles like CSGO or some MOBAs it can run decently, but for general "gaming" it falls on its face a bit.  If gaming is something you do on the side and just need a well built all-arounder for a decent price, this is a good option.  But if you are looking for a dedicated device for gaming, unless you have low standards I would not bet on this unit.  the mobile 3050ti is pretty unpowerful.  Probably around 40% slower than its desktop version if I had to guess.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2022

review_title: Outstanding Profile And Performance Versus Thermals Control
review_body: This laptop is elevated by its rubber feet 2 cm off the ground.  This really allows more airflow to leave the laptop, which being an AMD system, gets hotter and uses active cooling more aggressively with performance.  While this is a laptop that should not be used for long periods of time without an A/C connection, one can actually game at full performance for 4 hours consistently with both fans going at maximum.  Thermal throttling takes quite a while (I could only get the 3050 Ti card to throttle after 1.5 hours of Doom Eternal at maximum settings).

review_body: I just received it today and for someone who is hardcore “build your own” when it comes to computers I was extremely surprised with how powerful this laptop is right out of the box! review_title: Customer Service From Hell - Do Not BUY!
review_body: I bought an LG gram laptop. It crapped out on my almost immediately. After dozens of calls with hold times of over an hour per call, I got a refund approved. That was months ago. They never sent the refund. Calls and emails go nowhere. There is zero personnel in the refund/warranty department. If your product dies during warranty period like mine did, you are totally screwed. I've never seen anything like this in my life, and I've dealt with AT+T, DMV, and all the other horrible bureaucracies. There is nothing worse than LG warranty service.

review_body: This is my 2nd Gram. I had the previous model 16" as well. I thought I wanted something "more" so I purchased a Spectre with a 16" OLED and a faster CPU etc... I was a little disappointed they removed the finger print scanner, but its not the end of the world. The new matte screen, 12th gen CPU, 4th gen NVME, DDR5, etc.. more than make up for it!

review_body: I needed a new laptop and waited patiently until Prime Day. I got this exact configuration for only $200! That said, even if you pay more, it is TOTALLY WORTH IT. I've been using it for a few months and I have NO complaints. It's super snappy and fast. Web browser and apps load quickly and touch screen works beautifully. Very easy to convert into tent mode and tablet mode. I'm a tutor so I use the touch screen feature often for my virtual classes. I highly recommend the Joyroom Stylus Pen. The screen is super sharp and the speakers are great. It's probably a tad heavier than I would like but totally manageable. Laptop shopping can be exhausting, so if you're looking for a fast, touchscreen laptop mainly for web browsing under $500, THIS IS THE ONE!

product_name: Lenovo - 2022 - IdeaPad Flex 5i - 2-in-1 Chromebook Laptop Computer - Intel Core i3-1115G4 - 13.3" FHD Touch Display - 8GB Memory - 128GB Storage - Chrome OS
review_title: Be wary of the warranty- You need to request a ticket to get your full year.
review_body: I'm really not happy with the purchase of this machine.  The first one arrived, we charged it, and the screen would not work.  We confirmed the battery was green and working, and that the blinking light on the power button meant it was in sleep mode.  We tried all of the tips on Lenovo's help forum to no avail.  Upon scanning the QR code, we discovered we were already three months into the warranty.  So we returned it for an exchange.  When the new one came today we scanned the code again.  This one as well was a couple of months into warranty.  So, we hunted around on their website and found an article that they base the warranty start date on when a supplier purchases the machine and add a single month.  I have tried several times to update the warranty via their ticket process yet, every time I go to actually submit the ticket, it's freezing and not going through.  This one so far at least seems to work.  However, they should include information on the warranty with the device.  At the very least they should make it clear on their site without having to hunt it down that they have a process to update it (assuming it works as I've been unsuccessful thus far).
review_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 28, 2022

I use a 10.1" Duet with removable keyboard for performing and I had a Duet 5 (13.3") with removable keyboard for all other needs. I realized I didn't need another machine with removable keyboard, so I bought this Flex 5i to replace the larger one. The screen is gorgeous and the keyboard is a dream to type on. The 8gb of ram makes for smooth operation and I purchased a 256gb mini SD card to complement the 64gb onboard storage. The battery life isn't quite what I expected, but it's not bad. I would definitely recommend this chromebook to anyone with average computing needs and a need to watch the budget.

product_name: Lenovo - 2022 - IdeaPad Flex 5i - 2-in-1 Chromebook Laptop Computer - Intel Core i3-1115G4 - 13.3" FHD Touch Display - 8GB Memory - 128GB Storage - Chrome OS
review_title: Performance noticeably worse than Flex 5i with 128GB SSD
review_body: I purchased this Flex 5i with 64GB eMMC (~$300) and the one with 128GB Samsung SSD (~$400) to compare. Using chrome:\\system I confirmed they are running the same CPU, the same amount of memory (8GB), and the same platform (Volteer) . Although there doesn't seem to be much hardware difference, their performance is noticeably different. The 64GB unit's Linux virtual machine is completely tying up the CPU, while it is using a very small percent of CPU resources/time on the 128GB unit. On the 64GB unit, 10 tabs in Chrome is all it takes to see significant lag when switching between tabs, and sometimes the mouse lags and jumps around the screen. I only saw this behavior on the 128GB unit after opening something like 40 tabs, and even then it wasn't as bad. The other extremely noticeable difference is that the 64GB unit can only drive an external 1920 x 1080 display at 30Hz interlaced, resulting in obvious motion blur while scrolling on websites, while the 128GB unit can drive the same display at full 60Hz with no observable motion blur. Although the 128GB unit is  ~33% ($100) more than the 64GB unit, I find the latter unusable, and therefore the former is well worth the additional cost.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2022

review_title: First computer of any kind I've had to return
review_body: So frustrating ... this is the first electronic device of any kind I've ever had to return. Possibly just a fluke, because this product was well-reviewed by Wirecutter, but within an hour of getting it set up, the keyboard started failing. I couldn't type anything. I had control of the cursor with the mouse and touchpad, but the keyboard was useless. Also: Twice the cursor has "taken over," and started ripping out a single letter, as if someone is holding the key down. The only way to stop it and regain control is to shut it off and reboot. Per tech support advice I did a factory reset, but the problems continued, both those described above. I'm done. Sending it back. Won't be getting another Lenovo if at all possible. Major hassle.

product_name: Lenovo - 2022 - IdeaPad Flex 5i - 2-in-1 Chromebook Laptop Computer - Intel Core i3-1115G4 - 13.3" FHD Touch Display - 8GB Memory - 128GB Storage - Chrome OS
review_body: This Lenovo - 2022 - IdeaPad Flex 5i - 2-in-1 Chromebook Laptop Computer is surprisingly good.  My past experiences with Intel i3 processors have been horrible. Although it might make a laptop unusably slow, the Intel i3 works great in this chromebook.  So far, it has handled everything we have asked it to do.  It even handles my son’s favorite game, Robolox (it is not super-fast, but the game is playable).  The touch screen is also a great added feature. Lenovo is a trusted brand, and I have never had a problem with a Lenovo before.  I expect this chromebook to last a while.  Overall, if you need a reliable chromebook with enough power to do school work or browse the internet, I recommend this one.

review_title: Great chromebook, but i only get 5 hours of battery life
review_body: this is my second chromebook (still like my 5 year-old 11.6 inch Asus C202SA 4GB/16GB which is still going strong, but it has reached the end of its automatic OS updates). this one is MUCH faster, has a lot more memory 8GB and storage 128GB, but is also quite a lot heavier (and cost twice as much). i like the tablet mode, too, although i don't have much need for android apps and haven't installed linux. nice screen (though 250 nits is a little low), terrific backlit keyboard. but the battery does not last me more than 5 hours, which is a shame, considering i am only using it for browsing and google docs. turned off bluetooth, which helped a bit. i'm envious of those getting 10-hour battery life. but i'll have to keep the unit because i'm in india and there is no easy way to return it to amazon in the US though i have had it for only one week.

product_name: Lenovo - 2022 - IdeaPad Flex 5i - 2-in-1 Chromebook Laptop Computer - Intel Core i3-1115G4 - 13.3" FHD Touch Display - 8GB Memory - 128GB Storage - Chrome OS
review_title: It was love at first sight!
review_body: The best bang for your buck. 8gb ram: 128gb of expandable storage. You could do a lot with these specs. I love the color and size. This is my first chrome book and I’m getting to know it’s operations quickly. The only two issue I see so far is that I have no access to Netflix when I go to the play store. Tubi tv is there. The other issue is that sometimes it takes some time to wake up from sleep mode but it’s not a big issue, tapping on the power button on the right side helps. Oh! The auto updates are good until June of 2029! That’s 7 years from now. I love this cute little thing. I won’t be using my Lenovo PC as much now. Get it before it’s gone.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 14, 2022

product_name: Lenovo - 2022 - IdeaPad Flex 5i - 2-in-1 Chromebook Laptop Computer - Intel Core i3-1115G4 - 13.3" FHD Touch Display - 8GB Memory - 128GB Storage - Chrome OS
review_body: This was delivered yesterday. I unboxed it and plugged it in to find that the battery will not charge above 38% and it immediately powers off when unplugged. No biggy, this stuff happens.  I called lenovo customer service to trouble shoot and was told id get a call back in 24-48 hours between 8am and 8pm. An entire weekend gone waiting at home for a call to maybe come in at some pojnt. I will never buy another lenovo product again. Absolutely the worst CS.

review_title: Solid Chromebook - I guess, it's the only one I've used.
review_body: Man, I really like this Chromebook. I've had this model for a couple years, gave one as a gift and the recipient loves it. It looks like Lenovo might be moving on from this model, that's too bad. It's a great buy if you get it on sale. A decent one at full price, especially if you get 8gb/128gb. Remember it's just a Chromebook, so there are a few limitations. Think of it as a bigger phone or tablet that's easier to type on. I also enjoy the transition on Andriod from Chromebook to phone.

product_name: Lenovo - Legion 5 - Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 7 5800H - 16GB RAM - 512GB Storage - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050Ti - 15.6" FHD Display - Windows 11 Home - Phantom Blue
review_body: For the price the out of the box specs were solid. Hardware is has a nice no frills build. It games just fine and is quiet, making a decent work/game combo. Comes with Windows 11, which I like but many will hate this update as the design and interface is more like osx. The track pad is just okay but acceptable if you use an external mouse. The 15" made good use of keyboard space with an fps screen. Overall for $1k this build is great with amd7 and gtx. If you had the option though I would spend the extra $500 for the better gpu. ram and ssd can be upgraded later which is another nice spec. Web cam sucks if you need it. Will update if there's any hardware issues. Amazon shipped it international inside of a week!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2022

product_name: Lenovo - Legion 5 - Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 7 5800H - 16GB RAM - 512GB Storage - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050Ti - 15.6" FHD Display - Windows 11 Home - Phantom Blue
review_title: Will have to pay lots of money to use this computer
review_body: First off,  I got this computer for video editing.  With DaVinci Resolve.  It will not let me move files from my phone to the computer without first loading them into One drive first.  I loaded like 5 videos on one drive and now it is full and requires an upgrade which is 7 to 10 dollars per month.  Go to lenovo support and only options is to upgrade device and memory.....no actual help here,  just more money extortion.  On top of all of that.  Recording music through voice recorder is impossible also as there is no settings to switch input from microphone to input jack.  So it will not record anything from the combo headphone jack.  So now I can't add my audio files to the computer either.  Complete waste of a lot of money....my laptop I bought in 2009 is still an easier and better machine.  Don't waste your money here or you will just have to keep wasting it....with all the onedrive charges,  and subscriptions you must have to run this computer.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2022

review_title: I got ripped off by Amazon!
review_body: I bought this item for $1089.99 a week before it went down to $949.99. When I called Amazon to get the difference refunded, they refused and said I have to return it and re-purchase it and that the fund will be back on my card in 5-7 days. It makes no sense why a business like Amazon would rather lose my sale entirely but you bet I will be returning this and not repurchasing it through amazon. You can thank your customer service rep I spoke to for not understanding how businesses and loyalty works.

review_body: I'm pretty impressed with this laptop and it's price. I'm a Linux user so the first thing I do with a new laptop is replace whatever it came with with my current fave flavor of Linux. I've been using Linux Mint for the past few years so I decided to stick with it. After the initial install, wifi wasn't working and it wouldn't always wake up from sleep. A quick upgrade to the latest kernel version fixed those issues and I've had no further problems since. I do occasional 3d modeling work and everything has been snappy and good with this guy. I do miss the 4k screen on my older Lenovo but this is fine. For a gaming laptop, it's not too heavy or bulky. I think they did a good job designing these models.

product_name: Lenovo - Legion 5 - Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 7 5800H - 16GB RAM - 512GB Storage - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050Ti - 15.6" FHD Display - Windows 11 Home - Phantom Blue
review_title: Much faster than anticipated for gaming.
review_body: I got this to use in my bedroom as a secondary gaming rig for the evening, what i didn't expect was that it would be so much better than my primary. I have a PC that isn't very old, with AM3+ 32gig/GTX1070 water cooled and i expected the laptop to be slightly below this in performance based on ratings, however the opposite is true. The laptop with ryzen far exceeds and in many cases double the FPS in many of the games i play on the same settings as my main rig. The 3050TI really shines with this processor, and the advanced sound controls really take it the rest of the way there. And the fans on this thing are impressive, it maintains low temps and you can feel the air really blasting out of the sides, and it's not nearly as loud as my main PC.

product_name: Lenovo - Legion 5 - Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 7 5800H - 16GB RAM - 512GB Storage - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050Ti - 15.6" FHD Display - Windows 11 Home - Phantom Blue
review_title: Legion you are perfect to me <3
review_body: This is my first gaming laptop! I’ve been looking for awhile for a good gaming laptop. I’ve looked through Razer, Asus, Gigabyte mostly the big brands then I saw this Lenovo Legion and I thought to myself why I’m I looking at those high end gaming laptops when it’s my first gaming laptop and Knowing that I would probably just toss it around and it’ll just get wreck in my backpack and stuff. So why not save some money. For a thousand bucks this exceeded my expectations, it runs triple A games flawlessly with no problems at all. It’s super fast out of the box. Only bloatware it came with was McCafé so I didn’t do much cleaning, it was ready game. I never paid attention to Lenovo before, didn’t know they make good gaming laptops but actually this laptop looks good, it doesn’t scream I’m a gamer, I can take it out in class and at the library without gaining much attention, Very stealth looking. It’s all plastic but the build feels solid. The fans are loud as always with any gaming laptops. The keyboard is soft, feels good to type on. The best thing is that the laptop is upgradable, the 2x RAM, 2x SSD, Wi-Fi and battery are easily accessible without voiding warranty, yes Lenovo allows those upgrades so don’t worry. The hybrid mode aka mux switch is good to have too. The screen looks good without even calibrating it. There are lots of air vents specially a huge vent under the laptop so very good cooling. If you’re on a budget student gamer well this is a good choice for you. For a thousand bucks you get an AMD Ryzen, RTX series, SSD, dual channel RAM, IPS fast monitor, Mux switch, windows 11, 3 months xbl ultimate sheesh can’t beat that.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2022

product_name: Lenovo - Legion 5 - Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 7 5800H - 16GB RAM - 512GB Storage - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050Ti - 15.6" FHD Display - Windows 11 Home - Phantom Blue
review_body: I have built my own computers since 1999.  I know what I want in them and how much it's gonna cost me.  I never buy the latest stuff, I keep it about a year old and has served me well.  But this time after a friend's advice I dove into the gamin laptop and am very pleased.  No it's not the legion 7 but it's new and has what I need.  Quick fire up, minimal bloat software, slapped in another 1 TB drive, created my local account, updated everything, loaded MW and I was off to the races.  Great machine.  I will be getting the 80 watt battery to give it the power boost it needs to really open it up.  Very happy.  We'll worth it and highly recommend.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2022

product_name: Lenovo - Legion 5 - Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 7 5800H - 16GB RAM - 512GB Storage - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050Ti - 15.6" FHD Display - Windows 11 Home - Phantom Blue
review_body: I had been looking at this specific computer for a while and was going to buy it directly from Lenovo since the price matched the one here on Amazon. But that was the base model with a worse graphics card, screen, refresh rate, ext. I don’t remember well anymore because I got it almost two months ago but there was 5 or 6 higher end features that would have cost nearly $2000 if I had gotten it directly from Lenovo. The battery life is poor and it can’t go more than two hours of use without being plugged in, and in video games it performs significantly worse unplugged than plugged in. But putting that annoyance aside the machine works great and is a beast at running games. I’ve yet to get a game that it wouldn’t run over 60fps and it runs warzone on max graphics at around 115-125 frames. I’m not being paid to say this so you can trust my review if you’ve read this far. It’s a good investment if you aren’t too concerned about battery life.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2022

review_body: I've got this computer so I don't have to use my desktop computer for work, or travel. The battery life is not impressive. I usually can get four hours of battery before I plug it in (usually around 25%). EDIT: You can easily get better or worse battery based on the setting, which are pretty easy to navigate.

review_body: After running it some time I had no choice but to add a 2TB 2.5in HDD drive and a Samsung 16gig memory stick which I installed all at once I use it everyday with a 5 fan dock and I'm super pleased with its quality and performance as I play over and up to 14 games consistently depending how I'm feeling. I do wish this model had the 120hz screen but no matter as my 144hz gaming monitor does the heavy lifting while I'm at home. I'm so pleased I waited 4 years to get a laptop like this. It does not disappoint. Gonna hop back on Cyberpunk 2077 now.. Thanks to the business for the fair price and care...

review_title: Can't Beat it For the Price
review_body: A fantastic laptop for the low price. The look and design of the laptop is very nice and sleek. The only odd thing about it is the fans on the side pushing all the ports to the middle of the sides. Everything worked out of the box and the MSI Dragon Center is one of the best control centers I've seen among all my previous computers. They keyboard is also very nice. I love the rgb control you have and the presets you can choose from are very satisfying. The laptop has also been very quiet so far. While it has gotten just a little warm, I feel like that's to be expected with literally any gaming laptop on the market so I don't think I can knock it for that, especially when its been minimal.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: REASON FOR PURCHASE - I purchased this laptop because my Dell XPS 8100 desktop kept freezing/restarting several times a day.  A fresh clean re-install of Windows 10 was not remedying the situation, and I had no desire to troubleshoot every component to see what was the underlying problem.  Overall, this issue was seriously affecting my productivity, as well as sanity.

review_body: I love MSI, I really do, but as many know, MSI isn't the best, but it works beautifully. At first I kept running into a blue screen, but after updating all the drives, it works great, just got to keep it up to date or you will get a blue screen and your computer will restart. The anti glare screen was the very first thing I notices. The main down fall with this computer is the battery. It is absolutely horrible. The fans are a little loud, but they work okay. I did notice that my computer likes to over heat, but with the boost cool on the MSI Drangon Application on the PC, it will cool your laptop quickly, just don't forget to turn it off lol. But over all, a great piece of equipment, and can't wait to see what else MSI has to offer

review_body: Previously I had an old dell laptop from a few years ago with HD disk and the difference in speed with SSD is very good. The design of this laptop is very comfortable and elegant. For the cost I think it is a very good option. The only detail that I have noticed is the webcam, which does not have much video quality. The size of the screen is adequate, it is not very large but it is not small either, so being a thin laptop allows you to travel comfortably. You can also upgrade to Windows 11. If your budget is not big enough to buy a laptop of 2,000 USD or more, this is an excellent option.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: It is a very good laptop. I have had no problems with it. It’s light easily portable and has dual usb-c. It was the only laptop in an affordable price range at the time of purchase that has an r-series and dual usb-c. Only things to take into consideration is that it only has one nvme slot and that’s it for hard drives. Also, upgrading the nvme and/or the ram is a full disassembly, which voids the warranty. Great laptop for a great price with drawbacks that can be overcome but are serious drawbacks.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: A slim and discreet laptop you can play games on
review_body: Delivers on what it says.  Slim and light so it's one of the few 15.6" laptops that I would carry around.  I like the subtle design and I'm not a fan of the looks of many gaming laptops.  Also, had plenty of power to play games (AAA) at 1080p.  As long as you're not expecting desktop power and 4k gaming, this will hit the spot.  It also does so at considerably less energy cost than a desktop.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: This is a replacement for my MSI GT70 which is showing its age.  Quick, responsive...extremely quiet.  Able to handle everything from my day to day needs as well as my Civ 6 fix (maxed out graphics/everything).  The plethora of heat vents disperses heat efficiently.  Overall, quite pleased with this laptop.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: I had two goals for this purchase, to replace the 6.6 pound travel laptop and get a gaming machine so as not to have to rebuild my aging desktop. This one absolutely fits the bill. It weighs half as much (can be easily carried in one hand) and is great for gaming. Multi-screen options are extensive with the Thunderbolt 4 port not to mention built in HDMI. It gets hot, so I am seriously considering a lap fan thingy. There was one hiccup on initial boot up day, upgrading from WIN 10 TO 11. I was deleting some of the stock fluff programs and changing some settings when I got blue screened and couldn't escape, not even Ctrl-Alt-Del. So I let the battery rundown, it shut down and after restart with AC power its run beautifully ever since, battery recharged, all is well.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: Me agrado mucho el producto tanto el diseño como el rendimiento que proporciona, la batería tiene una duración de máximo 5 horas normal y jugando u ocupando aplicaciones que exigen dura más o menos 1 hora y quince minutos, también cuenta con muy buena pantalla y el teclado te deja impresionado. Y hay que ser sinceros, la verdad a pesar de que me encanto desde la primera impresión con el uso vi que tiene algunos fallos en cuento una coneccion de puerto usb A lo cual pude solucionar, también hubiera sido mejor agregar otra ranura para añadir otro disco que ayude a tener más espacio y por último al ser tan delgada no tiene puerto Lan, que como opción tenemos la buena red WiFi con la que cuenta, pero hubiera sido bueno que venga incluido un adaptador de usb C a Lan lo cual quedaría fantástico para este dispositivo.

review_body: She is lightning fast, my game runs beautifully on it. I have 20 GB of mods and custom content on TS4 and she handles it nicely. Things to know: she gets really hot. This doesn't really bother me though, I just ordered a cooling pad to help her out. The battery life is also terrible, but that was to be expected and doesn't bother me. If those things tend to bother you, now you know! Other than that, I'm very happy with her performance and I recommend this laptop.

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: Be warned - this intel chip is not the best
review_body: The laptop, overall is a very nice machine, and it does what it says it does - gaming. The only unfortunate problem is that the processor, 1137h, is a 4 core machine. This is unacceptable in 2021, and the graphics card is bottlenecked by this fact. The new standard for gaming is 8 core, minimum, to make a significant difference in computing tasks. This is unfortunate, as I bought the laptop under the impression that it was an 8 core, and by the time I had set it up, the return window had closed.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: If you want to upgrade ram or SSD don't buy this
review_body: I wish I had known how difficult the upgrade process would be before I bought this laptop. a 512gb SSD isn't good for much and I planned to put another M.2 card in along with doubling the ram. Well that didn't go the way I wanted. This laptop wasn't built like 99% of others on the market and you have to remove the entire board to get at some of the components. I'm no stranger to cracking cases for simple upgrades but I decided not to do that with this machine. Otherwise it works flawlessly and it's ultra lightweight which is nice but I suspect that weight loss is why upgrading is such a hassle.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021

review_body: So far the laptop has been very good. I have seen none of the issues others have mentioned. The battery life seems decent enough when not doing any demanding tasks. The keyboard is pretty good, though the left control key is a bit too big for my liking. The lit keyboard is not super bright, but I think that is a good thing as it is still usable in a dark room without being distracting.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: Great performance, but speakers and battery...
review_body: This has great performance. And the keyboard action is fine. However, the speakers are sad. The sound is thin and low. I can do little with video or online sound without headphones unless the room is absolutely silent. For the price, these speakers are a disappointment. The battery is also the same. It does not last as long as other high performing laptops I have had. After about 5 hours, it needs recharging so I feel kind of tethered to the AC charger a little when I am somewhere or even sitting at home. I would say, if audio and long battery life are not a concern to you, this is a great computer. I am charging at work and then use it at home on battery so it is not a big concern usually. The tiny sound from the speakers is another matter. Wish they had put something with more power inside.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2021

A bigger hard drive then the 512gb would be nice but i just added an external hard drive.  Would have also liked to see it come with the thunderbolt hub they show with it but it's not included. review_body: I wasn't expecting great battery life, so I'm not disappointed there. You'll definitely need to plug it in if you plan on gaming. I have a screen issue that I can't screenshot. It's on the left side, and mainly affects text. Uninstalled and updated all drivers, and that didn't fix it. Not sure what's causing the issue. Outside of that, haven't had any issues with gaming or usability of the laptop. It's fast and powerful, albeit a little noisy when the fans get going, but that isn't an issue. Most reviews mentioned how hot it can run, so I bought a cooling pad and haven't had any issues. Would not recommend using your lap for a long gaming session.

review_body: Well, 6 days after my return window with Amazon has closed my laptop is dead. I'm going to lose all my info on my hard drive. It took me weeks to get games to run under 95c. So much troubleshooting and my time wasted. This laptop runs too hot to actually put it on your lap. It worked great for a few weeks and now it's dead. Great.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: Great Mid-Range Laptop for Gaming and Productivity!
review_body: This laptop is simple in design, but beautiful none the less.  The RTX 3060 graphic card runs well along with the 144hz screen to play games smoothly at a decently high frame rate.  I often use multiple applications at a given time when using for work and this laptop is able to still run without lag during this.  I am a fan of the Dragon Center for monitoring the status of the various functions as well.  The only issue I have faced may not be related to the laptop itself at all.  The laptop came with Windows 10 installed and gave the option to upgrade to Windows 11 during set up.  I did so, and while it most of the time works perfectly, there are intermittent times the screen goes blurry when the cursor interacts with something on the screen as well as the screen "glitching out" during this time.  I've had to restart a couple of times when it was like this and another time it simply stopped and began working again correctly.  I will be monitoring this and if need be, revert back to Windows 10.  Still, all in all a very solid, well working machine.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2022

review_body: This is a very nice and fast little laptop. I'll admit I didn't buy this for gaming. I bought this as an upgrade to my 7 year old laptop. I was going to go with an Alienware laptop I saw, but this one was quite a bit cheaper with a newer processor. I dont know much about computers, but this little guy starts up and is ready in seconds. My old laptop took almost 10 minutes to figure out what it was doing. Web pages and docs are pulled up in a second and basic functions are very fast. I like how I can change performance based on what I'm doing bit havent used that feature since it's so fast out of the box. It took a very short time to get set up and registered. I honestly couldn't be happier. I saw some mixed reviews on it and took a chance. I personally am not dissapointed. It may not operate as fast for other with more experience or as a gaming computer, but this works perfectly for my day to day operations. Very happy trying a new product and will probably be back for a second desktop at some point.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2022

review_body: I underestimated the power of this laptop.  I bought it for work use, as well as gaming during slow times. The poor quality and the impressive heat make this a tough sell even if it's cheaper than anything comparable.

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: Not a bad mobile gaming option. It's competitive with the performance of my 3080 on home PC.
review_body: I play Call of Duty Warzone and it's resource intensive. I've got most of my settings turned up and I'm getting 100-120 frames. Perfectly acceptable, it's 1080P but the game isn't pretty anyway. I'm traveling and needed a mobile option and this was better than an Xbox. It's not better than my gaming PC at home, but my gaming PC was 3 times the cost. I've run into a few strange glitches with sound card, but overall it's as solid as any other Windows laptop. Buy this if: You need a mobile desktop computer that can game. It's huge, heavy you can't game with it on your lap. I would never select this as my laptop for non-gaming. Don't buy this if: You need a fast laptop for school, work. Any reason other than gaming and the negatives will not outweigh the positives. I would never carry this with me daily.  I literally flew with this thousands of miles, parked it on a desk for gaming. Normally I use a Macbook air for work/personal. It's a tool, buy the right tool for the job.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: It does what it says on the tin!
review_body: My old laptop decided enough was enough after 12 years of loyal service - replaced it with this unit based on specifications I need for virtualization (I used 3 or 4 different OS's in my job).  Really not too bothered about the gaming specifications as I only play Civilization III and you can run that on printer memory its so small.  The laptop is very sleek, very lightweight and easy on the eye.  The fans can get a little noisy, especially when I have 2 virtual machines running simultaneously - but I accept the noise knowing that the laptop is going to last - always a trade off for something.  I went the extra mile and wrote to the manufacturers asking the maximum wattage for their lighting port - 100 watts if you want to know - so i purchased a 12 way hub and a 100W power supply so I can travel lightly and leave my desk hub behind with a single hookup cable (type c) as needed.  All in all, happy with my purchase
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: Haven't done much gaming but seems to do decent. Can't expect much from a RTX 3060. I can play at at least medium settings with most games with over 60fps. Battery life though different story. Playing games or not, seems to just drain with any application. Definitely use battery saver. Design though is incredibly nice. Bring a cloth of some sorts if you worry about smudges. Doesn't smudge easily but when it does, it a little bit of a pain to clean it off. For a $1300 gaming laptop, not bad especially with prices of all electronics.

review_title: GOOD LAPTOP, BAD SOFTWARE MSI M15 Stealth *SCREEN FLICKERING*
review_body: Bought the MSI M15 Stealth and was impressed by the presentation, after booting up the laptop for the first time the screen started flickering, no matter how many restarts, shutdowns, and updating / reinstalling drivers, the problem was still there. I did find a solution however, by full wiping the laptop then removing all MSI programs and features (Bloatware)  the flickering stopped. I contacted MSI support and they had no idea what planet they were on, so if you have this issue please follow the steps above to actually fix the issue and don't waste your time with MSI support. The laptop is really good but the fact you have to do this is quite annoying, hopefully, they will fix this for future production runs of this laptop.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: Thought it was a Good Laptop Until it had an Issue
review_body: I purchased this laptop roughly 3.5-4 months ago. I had been having issues with my docking station connecting, and after purchasing a new dock, it turned out the issue is with the computer itself. My thunderbolt port is completely dead, does not output power or transfer any data. Contacting the customer support for MSI, they told me I could send it back to them and they would attempt to repair it, but I would have to pay for shipping costs and it could take them up to 30 business days to fix the issue. I have to have access to my computer for work related tasks at home, so It is not really an option to lose my computer for over a month if it takes the full 30 business days. I am extremely disappointed in the quality of this gaming laptop so far, and will likely not be making another purchase from MSI.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2022

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)

The keyboard gets hot even on balance mode, the backlight keyboard is clunky (the toggle button works as it please) and the fans are quite noisy even on videocalls. product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_title: Great For Studying And For Gaming
review_body: As an upcoming college student who enjoys to play games but still needs a laptop to study on, I found that this laptop is exceedingly capable of doing both. Take this review with a grain of salt however as I am not really knowledgeable of the exact specs of the laptop and what the technical terms necessarily means. But what I know for sure is that this laptop is great for a combination of studying and gaming as 15.6' screen is the perfect balance between gaming laptop and a Chromebook, thus, not taking up all your desk space and allowing room for textbooks and journals, while still allowing for a comfortable screen size for gaming. The only true worry I have about the laptop is how hot it can get by just having the laptop in "Balanced Mode", a mixture between power saving and quality frames and resolution, near the vents. But I am sure this can be somehow dealt with either through adjustments, either through changing settings and another way. Overall, the MSI 15m Stealth is a great laptop for a student who wants to dabble in gaming alongside his studies at a great price as well.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2021

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: Esta laptop para juegos es una de las mejores compras que he hecho nunca, la calidad de la pantalla es excelente, es muy fluida y funciona sin problemas. En cuanto a todas las laptops para juegos, tienden a calentarse, así que asegúrate una almohadilla de refrigeración y actualiza tus controladores. Dragon Center es increíble, MSI realmente ofrece un trabajo de calidad, recomiendo encarecidamente este producto a cualquiera. La duración de la batería se puede ajustar pero desenchufar y, dependiendo de lo que estés haciendo, tendrás una cantidad decente de tiempo de juego o si estás haciendo trabajo, tareas escolares, etc. En general, esta sigue siendo una gran compra, definitivamente necesito comprar mi PC después de esto.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: The MSI Stealth 15M balances portability and pure power. The laptop is really light for a gaming laptop, being under 4 pounds yet it has a RTX 3060 inside. For being such a thin laptop, the keyboard surprisingly remains at a comfortable temperature while playing AAA games. The laptop also comes with a thunderbolt port which is a nice bonus. If you're gaming while plugged in, make sure to change power mode to best performance and if you want a further boost in performance, you change the User Scenario in the Dragon Center software to Extreme Performance. You can also activate the Cooler Boost if you don't mind more fan noise.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2021

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: I've owned 3 laptops and 2 custom built PC's, and I've gotta say that so far this is my favorite computer I've owned to date. I'm downsizing from a 17inch HP Omen gaming laptop (that weighed 10 pounds) but it is in no way a downgrade. I bought this mainly because it's lightweight, portable, has a long battery life, and can put out when it comes to gaming (high to ultra graphics on AAA @ 1080p). In addition to using it for gaming, I also teach high schoolers. Using it in the classroom will be a breeze BECAUSE OF HOW LIGHT AND PORTABLE IT IS. Also it has an HDMI port for hooking up to your projector, and 3 regular usb ports for your powerpoint clicker, mouse and USB all at the same time (also has 2 USB-C connections). No joke, I'm in love with this thing mainly because I've never had a laptop this light and I'm excited to take it everywhere with me without killing my back.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021

product_name: MSI Stealth 15M Gaming Laptop: 15.6" 144Hz FHD 1080p Display, Intel Core i7-11375H, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 16GB, 512GB SSD, Thunderbolt 4, WiFi 6, Win10, Carbon Gray (A11UEK-009)
review_body: Considering cell phones are breaking over 1K these days.. I'd rather spend my money on this. Sure it's loud with the cooler booster on (which keeps it cool enough too) but other than that. I have no issues. You game with the laptop plugged in so there hasn't been any speed issues so far for any games like Naraka: Bladepoint for example. Battery is terrible but again, you game with it plugged in sooo... All in all, I'm very satisfied with my purchase! Also, Upgradable RAM and storage far as I know.

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_title: Decent laptop if there wasn't a "microsoft tax"
review_body: The screen is beautiful, and the touchscreen response is great. The dedicated GPU is fine to run smaller games. There has been some screen flickering while using but this could potentially be fixed with a software update. Battery life is so far lasting just enough for 8ish hours with web browsing and using office products. It is definitely overpriced. If you don't need gaming or the touch screen, but instead performance for things like video editing, then a MacBook is without a doubt the product to get. This product is mostly for people that want a decent computer with adequate to mediocre performance for the price, a beautiful display with touchscreen capabilities, and a high refresh screen, all while keeping decent temperature. At first, I thought the 4 lbs. wouldn't be too noticeable since I used to have a 15-inch gaming laptop with about the same weight, but considering the smaller size of the surface and one of the main points going for it was the touchscreen, it actually does start feeling heavy.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_body: I bought the Surface Laptop Studio along with the Acer ConceptD 7 Ezel in order to compare them. The color and contrast on the Acer were obviously much better, and the Slim Pen 2 gets jittery when drawing slowly/carefully. However, the Surface display gets much brighter, and writing/drawing on it feels much more natural, mostly because of the awkward aspect ratio on the Acer and a very noticeable gap between its display and digitizer. I had also anticipated that the three set positions for the screen on the Surface might compare poorly against the Acer's infinitely variable "Ezel", but it didn't end up bothering me at all. I tend to use the middle position, where the display sits between the keyboard and touchpad, even when I'm holding it in one arm and using it in portrait mode. For some reason it just works for me.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2022

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_body: i went with a more basemodel configuration because of price. it makes this laptop pointless. it struggles to handle white board. im not even going to get into adobe apps like fresco. the drawing experience is second place to apple ipad pro. and i was born into a windows fanboy family. the screen is nice but not worth the asking price. this is a very heavy laptop for what it does. i cannot find a carrying case for it that i trust. for what you pay its obviously susceptible to damage. i legit use the box it came in to this day. i look like an idiot unboxing it in class every time but what i am i suppose to do buy a pelican case?! the form factor is nice. but it takes some time getting use to and i can tell if i used it regularly it would end up breaking. i have the newer MS pen. that syncs and works well. i wouldn't bother gaming on the base model in any form. it checks a lot of boxes for things like back lit keys but almost everything does now. the OS performs well. this laptop is not worth MSRP its the apple of microsoft products. youre paying a premium for the sake of paying a premium.  get something more cost effective.

review_body: After many years and Surface devices that were underpowered, finally a laptop with that Surface quality and reasonable specs. However, it barely makes it, for the price I'd expect at least a 3060, not a 3050Ti. But it's good enough for heavy tasks like game development and is an all-in-one for content creation.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2022

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_title: Epic Laptop for Office + Photo Editing/Video Editing (and home Tablet Use)!
review_body: Super happy with this laptop. I use it for some fairly heavy photo/video editing and as my daily/travel laptop. It functions perfectly as my daily work laptop (email, office suite, contracts, budgets, etc.), but has sufficient processing capacity and memory to support my photo/video editing. As a HUGE plus, the fact that this folds flat as a tablet has ensured that I pretty much never use my older iPad anymore as this replaces that device as well for home/couch use. In short, i've been super happy with this device and would recommend it to anyone. I'd also recommend pairing with the new Microsoft Dock 2 as it allows for connecting to all peripherals + multiple monitors. My only beef with the Surface Studio is that it has only  (2) USB 3 ports and (1) audio port (nothing else) which means you need a USB 3 hub for peripherals on the go (including card readers, etc.). All that said, its a very small complaint given the balance of the benefits/quality of the device.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2022

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_title: Hardware is good, windows 11 is not
review_body: Though a bit pricy, the hardware is pretty good. It can handle some midium weight gaming no problem; fast and stable while drawing (the pen is pretty good btw); the design is also very clean and good looking. It inherits all the same pros and cons of surface product line (good keyboard, bad IO. Seriously Microsoft, what's with the terrible IO?), with a significant drawback - Windows 11. It is buggy and lack features that I liked in Windows 10 (tablet mode, better start bar customization etc.)

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum

The screens looks fantastic and works amazing in conjunction with the Surface Pen 2. Great build quality, and all-around very happy. I was hesitant about the notched body, but it really isn't much of a bother, and it allows for the fans to run super quietly/efficiently, so it works out for the better.

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_title: A machine suitable for studio usage with questionable quality control
review_body: I have to say that this is the second Microsoft Surface product I have purchased over the course of four years. Previously I have a surface laptop 2 for my wife, and it seems not powerful enough to handle the school work she has to design for students. Everything looks vivid on the screen, and the aluminum chassis screams for supreme quality. However, that is not what you have expected. Within the first week, the first unit came up with a vertical green line on the screen. The troubleshooting steps provided by Microsoft are miserable. Ironically, feedbacks from the user communities are surprisingly good. (How the heck a tech giant failed to accomplish an entry level introduction to test their devices?)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2022

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_body: As a student looking to convert to a more digital format in terms of notes and schoolwork, this laptop is great! I've had it several months now and I use it with a surface pen to take notes with it as if it was a regular pen-and-paper notebook. The processor and graphics card also allow me to run all of my favorite video games smoothly without any technical difficulties. It is a large computer and is a bit more heavier than I would've preferred, but overall that's something I'm willing to sacrifice to be able to have everything in one place. The only real grudge I have with it is the battery life. If you're not running anything particularly battery consuming (ie. video games) it usually can last a few hours. However, be prepared to watch your battery levels drop when you play even 5 minutes of your favorite PC game.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2022

product_name: Microsoft Surface Laptop Studio - 14.4" Touchscreen - Intel® Core™ i7 - 32GB Memory - 1TB SSD - Platinum
review_title: Unreliable hardware, no international support, slow processor
review_body: This is my third Surface device from Microsoft, and I had very, very good luck with SP4 and SP6). And so, I purchased the i7 32GB RAM 2TB option. Having the ability to fold and rotate the screen to portrait mode really helped with certain types of data displays— that was great! That it was equipped with a somewhat dated i7 processor wasn’t a serious performance issue, as having a fast SSD and lots of RAM makes up for the somewhat slower/older i7 CPU that this is equipped with. However, the Surface Studio Laptop just lasted 4 months before the display failed suddenly and completely while on a work trip from the US to the UK. It seems that, while rare, hardware failures can happen with any computer. On a related note, I had a hardware failure with the SP4 when it was fairly new, and that was sorted quickly by Microsoft. And so, I had high hopes for a solution while I was traveling internationally for work.
